author: Staff Reporter
text:
A session’s court at Chidambaram has convicted and sentenced a woman to life imprisonment for the murder of a Sub-Inspector in 2014.

According to the prosecution, S.P. Ganesan, a native of Senthanadu near Panruti who was attached with Annamalai Nagar police station had an illicit affair with Vanitha of Thaiyakuppam near Killai.

However, he married Sathya of Vazhudareddi near Villupuram. When Sathya went to her parents’ place, Ganesan, who was on leave, went to Chidambaram to meet Vanitha. Vanitha purchased a knife from Puducherry and took it to Ganesan’s apartment on July 22, 2014. She got him drunk and slit his neck when he was asleep. Additional Sessions Judge D. Kingsley Christopher sentenced Vanitha to life-imprisonment, besides imposing a fine. – Staff Reporter
title: Woman gets life term for killing SI
